data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Forward steps have only 9 steps. You can only make 3 steps in a row. If you have to go down backward, there are 6 steps to get back up. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It says to go to the opposite direction and take 4 steps first. It doesn't say to turn around then turn right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instruction says you will start back at the beginning so you only need to walk 6 steps into the first direction. We have to turn around to get this sentence correct. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 7 steps. Take 7 steps and take 1 step. Turn left, take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After turning around, you return to the starting point. With 10 steps back, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around, take 7 steps, turn around, take 7 steps, turn around, turn around, take 7 steps, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and turn right and take 8 steps and take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You cannot return to the starting point if you already are there. Turning and taking 8 steps only returns to the beginning. Turning and taking 2 steps only takes one back to the beginning of the sequence. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face forward, you always have to face forward. A person who always faces left does not always return to her starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 2 steps to get back to the starting point. You take 7 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There are no instructions as to which direction you should go in. If you always face forward, in the following example, you want to take 3 steps forward and then again in reverse when you go backward. If you are always facing forward, but you want to take only 1 step backward, you should still begin going forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always be facing forward. If you take any steps backward, you will have to take a step backward. If you take any steps in the opposite direction, you will have to take two steps right at the same time. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only ever have to face forward when facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward in the beginning, after taking 4 steps left, you will take 3 more steps up and to your right. Then you should take 1 step right and you will return to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps right makes you look forward. Take 6 steps right is taken way back. You always facing forward and facing right. So, the answer is No.

Taking 8 steps carries 5 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Taking 4 steps carries 5 steps. Taking 8 steps carries 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you take 7 steps you get 1 mile, but when you take 9 steps you get 7 miles. If you take 9 steps then you get 9 yards back. If you take 7 meters you get 7 miles, but when you take 9 meters you get 1 mile back. So, the answer is No.

If you have a 4 door car, it is easier to get to the starting point than to turn around and return there. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, and start from the same place, the starting point is where you always start. One day, you will be facing forward for your first 7 steps, and take 2 steps right. The next day, you will be facing sideways, and you will take 7 steps left. One day, you will be facing left, and you will take 2 steps right. The last day, you will have been facing right, and you will take 10 steps right. The next day, you will be facing left, and you will take 21 steps. You start again from the beginning, but this time you are facing in the opposite direction. So, the answer is Yes.

For each step that is left at the beginning of the directions, you must complete at least 9 total steps. So, the answer is No.

Turning around does NOT require 4 steps. Just like you were turned around, you simply turn around. So, the answer is NO.

Take 6 steps left when facing left. Take 6 steps right when facing right. So, the answer is No.

Turn right and Take 5 steps. Turn around. Turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you could take 2 steps backward. The rules suggest taking just 1 step backwards. To take that many backwards, you can only take a single step forward. In the first example, the boy steps 3 ways, but 3 different numbers are made up. The fourth variation is the 4 numbers a girl, 5 boys, 6 girls. Three different numbers were made up. This variation was taken backwards, not forwards, or back and forth. If you take 3 backwards, you could only take 3 backwards, and thus you could only take 8 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.
